Description: Yellow painted pottery shabti with a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a summarily modelled face and crossed arms in relief holding two black relief hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs(very worn); the back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket(worn).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
